info.game_comments:
Tom Halpern game 2.
First 14 clues only.

(1, 1).clue: After Mr. Hyde kills a member of Parliament, he reveals the secret of his dual identity to a friend

(2, 1).clue: A small New England-style home with a gabled roof, named for a Massachusetts peninsula

(5, 1).clue: Due to a scandal, Sosuke Uno lost his job as this country's prime minister

(6, 1).clue: Born in New Orleans in 1911, she became the most famous gospel singer of her time

(1, 2).clue: The vicious Mordaunt beheads King Charles I in "Twenty Years After", Dumas' sequel to this

(2, 2).clue: Bats & bells both hang in this upper story of a  church tower

(5, 2).clue: Before her death in 1978, this Israeli said, "I forbid any eulogies or anything named for me"

(1, 3).clue: Wang Lung has a concubine named Lotus & a pretty slave named Pear Blossom in this Pearl Buck novel

(2, 3).clue: These accessories can be bulls-eye, bow or bay

(5, 3).clue: This debonair Canadian, a former P.M., has written several books, including "Two Innocents in Red China"

(1, 4).clue: Budgie, the title character of children's books writen by the Duchess of York, is one of these

(5, 4).clue: In 1961 the Vatican excommunicated this Haitian president for harassing the clergy

(1, 5).clue: Clyde is sentenced to death after the pregnant Roberta drowns in this T. Dreiser novel

(5, 5).clue: In 1905 Prince Carl of Denmark was elected king of this Scandinavian country
